meanings.definition: To cover or mark with chalk.
meanings.sent1: She bechalked the sidewalk with colorful drawings.
meanings.sent2: The teacher bechalked the blackboard with important notes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel bechalked the tree trunk with funny faces.
meanings.sent4: The artist bechalked the canvas with her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The children bechalked the playground with hopscotch patterns.

meanings.definition: To write or draw on with chalk.
meanings.sent1: He bechalked his name on the chalkboard.
meanings.sent2: The kids bechalked the pavement with a hopscotch grid.
meanings.sent3: The magician bechalked the stage with mysterious symbols.
meanings.sent4: The explorer bechalked the cave walls with directions.
meanings.sent5: The students bechalked the classroom desks with doodles.
